title: Radiology Clerk Interview

title: Nursing Care Partner Interview

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview

title: Patient Care Technician Interview

Interview Questions: How would my past employers describe me.

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was a quick process. I applied on the 8th and I got a call on the 10th for an interview. The manager that interviewed my was very nice and professional. I can tell she care about who she wants on her team .
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Chesapeake Regional Medical Center?

title: Care Partner Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center (Chesapeake, VA) in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: I applied online on a Wednesday. That Friday, I received a call from the unit manager to schedule an interview for Monday. I met with the unit manager and the clinical coordinator for the unit. They took turns asking me pretty standard interview questions. The interview lasted about 20 minutes, and I was told to expect a decision to be made the same day. The following Wednesday I received a call from HR to set up a phone interview for the following day. The HR interview took about 30 minutes, and it consisted of some questions about my job history and she went over some policies before presenting my official offer. I was then scheduled for a health screening which consisted of blood work and getting up to date of immunizations. I met with HR in person for some paperwork, then submitted my drug screen. The hiring process was very simple and straightforward, I was given a start date for my orientation 2 weeks out.
Interview Questions: What does professionalism mean to you? Tell me about a time you went above and beyond in regards to customer service?

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: the interview very easy going, there was an initial interview with the hiring manager then a peer interview. this took about 3 weeks total. not a bad interview process at all
Interview Questions: name. an achievement you are most proud of

title: Registered Nurse, BSN, MSN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center (Chesapeake, VA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Standard industry questions. There was a phone interview, a face to face interview that included a  standard background and drug screen test. There was an opportunity to meet on the floor with several of the current employees in order to ask questions and to be able to get a feel for the floor that I would be working.
Interview Questions: They were interested in my experience, and my interests in exploring future goals including school and professional. There were no difficult questions during the interview. Just the standard questions regarding availability, requirements from both parties, visions for the future.

title: Nursing Care Partner Interview

Interview Questions: They asked what is your stand with working with different race/nationality of people in a group.

title: Registrar Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center (Chesapeake, VA) in Oct 2015

I came in, pretty much parroted what was already on my resume, discussed what I'd be doing at the hospital from day to day and what was expected from me performance wise.
Interview Questions: Do you understand what this position entails?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center (Chesapeake, VA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very  good.  Interviewer made me feel at ease.  Hiring manager was very pleasant also.  She gave a tour of the facility and introduced me to others on the unit.  Staff was friendly and welcoming.

title: Case Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very thorough . Great coordination of interviews First was with the Director of Department, then had panel interview with department  peers.  Overall it took about two weeks from application to interview. Another week for a decision, after checking references and meeting with HR to show proof of educational background and licensure. Orientation is six weeks(which is fantastic). Short, appropriate general orientation followed by department job specific orientation.  Lots of one on one time with front line colleagues showing you how the work is really done and allowing to you develop your own best practices.
Interview Questions: Nothing unexpected was asked. Standard questions but definitely looking fora good fit with the rest of the  team

title: Finance Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center (Chesapeake, VA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview process but it was 7 years ago. I have been a part of interviews prior to leaving and there appears to be a broken process. Managers have to constantly keep after HR to send more applications to them so they can get people to interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself five years from now?

title: Executive Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Chesapeake Regional Medical Center (Chesapeake, VA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by phone and then came in for a 6 hour interview. I met with executive team for an hour and then had separate interviews with different department leaders. The interview process was one that I expected since I had been an executive leader in the past.
Interview Questions: How can you bring the team together?
